intro: Silene glareosa subsp. marginata, commonly known as the marginated catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, marginate leaves that have a distinct white or pale edge. It typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. This plant is relatively short-lived and is considered a rare or endangered species in some regions.
